sentences.en: [with clause]Clive had let slip he was married.
sentences.cn: 克莱夫无意中说出他已经结婚了。

sentences.en: Ben slipped quietly out of the room.
sentences.cn: 本悄悄地溜出了房间。

sentences.en: But for you, they might have given us the slip.
sentences.cn: 要不是你，我们可能已经被他们甩掉了。

sentences.en: Emergency workers fear that the burning ship could slip its moorings.
sentences.cn: 急救人员担心燃烧着的船只可能会脱链滑走。

sentences.en: He gave reporters the slip by leaving at midnight.
sentences.cn: 他在午夜时分离开，避开了记者的追踪。

sentences.en: He had slipped on an icy pavement.
sentences.cn: 他在结冰的人行道上滑倒了。

sentences.en: he lay there and quietly slipped away.
sentences.cn: 他静静地躺在那儿，安详地去世了。

sentences.en: He let the ball slip through his grasp and into the net.
sentences.cn: 球从他的掌中滑出，钻进了球门。

sentences.en: He might have let something slip in a moment of weakness.
sentences.cn: 他可能一时大意说漏了嘴。

sentences.en: He's a mere slip of a lad compared to his brother.
sentences.cn: 跟他哥哥一比，他不过是个小毛孩。

sentences.en: His popularity slipped further after a series of scandals.
sentences.cn: 一连串丑闻之后，他的支持率进一步下降。

sentences.en: I wanted to duck down and slip past but they saw me.
sentences.cn: 我本想弯腰溜过去，但被他们看到了。

sentences.en: Inside the passport was a folded slip of paper.
sentences.cn: 护照里面有张折起的纸片。

sentences.en: It amazed him how easily one could slip into a routine.
sentences.cn: 他惊异地发现人很容易在不知不觉中因循守旧起来。

sentences.en: let slip the dogs of war.
sentences.cn: 发动战争。

sentences.en: One man managed to slip from the club as police arrived.
sentences.cn: 警察到来时，一个男子设法溜出了俱乐部。

sentences.en: She was just a slip of a thing.
sentences.cn: 她才是个小丫头。

sentences.en: Slip in a few questions about other things.
sentences.cn: 见缝插针地提几个题外的问题。

sentences.en: Slip-on shoes are easier to put on than lace-ups.
sentences.cn: 一脚蹬比系带鞋容易穿。

sentences.en: Standards have slipped in many parts of the industry.
sentences.cn: 这一行业中许多方面的标准都已下滑。

sentences.en: The girls had made three crucial slip-ups.
sentences.cn: 这些女孩犯下了3个重大的错误。

sentences.en: The slightest little bit of inattention can let something slip through.
sentences.cn: 稍不留神就会让某些东西蒙混过关。

sentences.en: There's been a slip-up somewhere.
sentences.cn: 有个地方出了点小错。

sentences.en: they often slipped up when it came to spelling.
sentences.cn: 一到拼写，他们就经常出差错。

sentences.en: We must be well prepared, there must be no slips.
sentences.cn: 我们必须好好准备，一定不要有差错。

sentences.en: Wright slipped but managed to keep hold of the ball.
sentences.cn: 赖特滑了一下，但球还抓在手里。

sentences.en: you are little more than a slip of a girl.
sentences.cn: 你还只是个瘦小的小姑娘。

sentences.en: You’re slipping, Doyle! You need a holiday.
sentences.cn: 你状态更差了，多伊尔！你需要去度个假。

words.tran_cn: [地质]滑动的；有活结的；活络的
滑，滑倒；片，纸片；错误；下跌；事故
[地质]滑动；滑倒；犯错；失足；减退
[地质]使滑动；滑过；摆脱；塞入；闪开

phrases.phrase: let something slip through one's fingers (或 grasp)

phrases.tran_cn: v. 溜进；使滑入；匆忙穿上；[俚]大吃

phrases.phrase: slip one over on【非正式用语】

phrases.tran_cn: 滑移面；滑动面；滑面；侧滑面
滑移比率，滑率，滑差系数

phrases.phrase: there's many a slip 'twixt cup and lip
phrases.tran_cn: (谚)杯到嘴边还会失手（指万事难以十拿九稳，事情往往功败垂成）

trans.tran_cn: 串行线路接口协议，是旧式的协议（Serial Line Interface Protocol）
滑动的；有活结的；活络的
差错，便条，摔跤，衬裙，守场员
trans.tran_en: A slip is a small or unimportant mistake
to slide a short distance accidentally, and fall or lose your balance slightly

trans.tran_cn: 滑倒，脱落，溜走，退步，陷入
trans.tran_en: to go somewhere, without attracting other people’s attention
to slide a short distance accidentally, and fall or lose your balance slightly
